author: The Hill staff
description: President Trump is planning to deliver a speech focused on his efforts around affordability at the McDonald’s Impact Summit Monday evening. The audience will include McDonald’s owners, operators and suppliers gathered in Washington, D.C. It comes as Trump has said Republicans need to focus more on messaging their efforts to bring down the cost of…
title: Watch live: Trump speaks at McDonald’s Impact Summit

author: Amie Parnes
description: Democrats say the Jeffrey Epstein files are capturing the President Trump they have tried to portray for years, predicting the controversy will paint the darkest image of Trump to date. They have dug into the issue and see it as a crisis for Trump because it cuts a wedge between the president and his core supporters.  “The…
title: Democrats predict Epstein controversy will hit Trump supporters hard

author: Max Rego
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott (R) has scheduled the runoff election for the vacant House seat in the Lone Star State’s 18th Congressional District for Jan. 31.  The seat has been vacant since March, when former Rep. Sylvester Turner (D-Texas) passed away. Turner, the former mayor of Houston who was first elected to Congress in November…
title: Abbott sets runoff for Sylvester Turner’s House seat for Jan. 31

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Indiana Gov. Mike Braun (R) said on Monday he was “committed” to standing with President Trump on redrawing the state’s maps ahead of 2026, after state lawmakers said last week they didn’t have the votes to convene over redistricting. “I just had a great call with President Trump! I told him I remain committed to…
title: Braun reiterates support for Indiana redistricting after call with Trump

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A new ad unveiled Monday from a conservative group led by former Vice President Mike Pence is taking aim at President Trump’s signature drug pricing policy.  A six-figure digital ad campaign from Advancing American Freedom (AAF) calls the White House’s “most-favored-nation (MFN)” drug pricing as “socialist price controls.”  However, the ad doesn’t mention President Trump at all. Instead, it shows images of…
title: Pence group rips Trump’s drug pricing plan in new ad campaign

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump said Monday he will greenlight the sale of F-35 advanced fighter jets to Saudi Arabia, ahead of a high-profile visit by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman this week to Washington, D.C.  U.S. law requires that any weapons sale package to countries in the Middle East does not risk Israel’s security, it’s so-called…
title: Trump greenlights sale of F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump said on Monday that he is willing to launch strikes inside Mexico if it is necessary to thwart the smuggling of illegal narcotics into the U.S.  “Would I launch strikes into Mexico to stop drugs? OK with me. Whatever we have to do to stop drugs,” the president said at the White House. …
title: Trump open to conducting strikes in Mexico to thwart drug smuggling

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said Monday he would sign legislation into law releasing files linked to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, noting the fallout over the files is a “Democrat problem.”  “Sure I would,” Trump told reporters when asked if he would sign the legislation. “Let the Senate look at it. Let anybody look at it.” “It’s…
title: Trump says he’d sign bill releasing Epstein files: ‘It’s really a Democrat problem’

author: Joseph Choi
description: Medicare Part B premiums will rise by about 10 percent in 2026 according to a notice from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). The CMS released a notice laying out the monthly actuarial rates for Medicare Part B beneficiaries beginning in 2026. For seniors and disabled enrollees, the monthly actuarial rates will be…
title: Seniors hit with 10 percent Medicare Part B cost increase in 2026

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump and FIFA President Gianni Infantino on Monday announced expedited visa processing for individuals attending next year’s FIFA World Cup in the U.S.  Speaking in the Oval Office next to Trump, Infantino revealed what he called the “FIFA Pass,” which is a “prioritized appointment scheduling system” for World Cup ticket holders to get visas…
title: Trump says 2026 World Cup ticket holders to get priority US visas

author: Max Rego
description: Former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has joined the advisory board of Ukrainian defense company Fire Point amid a corruption investigation into the firm.  Pompeo served as CIA director and chief U.S. diplomat during President Trump’s first administration and is a staunch backer of Ukraine amid its war against Russia.  Fire Point, based in Kyiv,…
title: Pompeo joins board of major Ukrainian drone and missile maker

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said Monday his voice sounds hoarse because he was shouting during trade talks.  “I feel great. I was shouting at people because they were stupid about something having to do with trade and a country, and I straightened it out,” Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.  “But I blew my stack at…
title: Trump says his voice is hoarse because he was shouting during trade talks

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) called on Harvard University to cut ties with Larry Summers, a faculty member and former president of the school, over ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.  “For decades, Larry Summers has demonstrated his attraction to serving the wealthy and well-connected, but his willingness to cozy up to a convicted sex offender…
title: Warren urges Harvard to cut ties with Larry Summers

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration is proposing to narrow which bodies of water qualify for Clean Water Act protections.  The administration proposed a new definition Monday for what counts as a “water of the United States” and is therefore subject to federal pollution regulations under the Clean Water Act. The issue is a controversial one, with developers,…
title: Trump proposes to narrow where Clean Water Act applies

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) borrowed some of the president’s own language in response to President Trump’s recent change of position on files linked to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. “He got tired of me winning,” Massie said Monday in an interview, according to Politico, mirroring comments made by the president in the past. On…
title: Massie on Trump’s Epstein files U-turn: ‘He got tired of me winning’

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump is slated to ramp up his affordability message in a speech slated for the McDonald’s Impact Summit in Washington on Monday.  A White House official confirmed to The Hill that the president will zero in on the tax cuts in his One Big Beautiful Bill Act, including tax breaks on tips, overtime and…
title: Trump to dial up affordability message in McDonald’s summit speech

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) on Monday sidestepped a question about reporting that he’s laying the groundwork for a 2028 presidential run. In an interview on Fox News’s “The Faulkner Focus,” Cruz laughed when asked to respond to an Axios headline: “Scoop: Cruz eyes 2028 run.” “You know, reporters are going to write headlines that get…
title: Ted Cruz responds to presidential talk: Wins are ‘historic’

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has warned that the U.S. economy is showing signs of strain, and that if the Federal Reserve doesn't cut rates soon, the pain could spread quickly, leading to a recession that will be unlike any before it due to America's lack of preparedness.
title: The next recession is coming — and this time, you’re the collateral

author: The Hill staff
description: President Trump will meet Monday afternoon with members of the 2026 World Cup task force, which he established in March to help plan the quadrennial soccer tournament being hosted next year in cities across the Americas. Trump named himself chair of the task force, Vice President Vance as vice chair and various Cabinet secretaries and…
title: Watch live: Trump meets with World Cup 2026 task force at White House

author: Tara Suter
description: A bipartisan group of House members is set to host survivors of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein for a Tuesday press conference. Reps. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.), Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) and Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) will gather at 9 a.m. Tuesday on Capitol Hill alongside “survivors of Jeffrey Epstein’s abuse,” according to a press release obtained…
title: Greene, Massie, Khanna to host Epstein survivors for Tuesday press conference

author: David Rudenstine, opinion contributor
description: Chief Justice John Roberts is at a crossroads in the tariffs case, and must decide whether to uphold a constitution that strengthens American democracy or to be Trump's loyal lackey.
title: Will Chief Justice Roberts strike down Trump’s tariffs, or remain his lapdog?

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump increased pressure Monday on Indiana Republicans, threatening to endorse against state lawmakers who oppose redistricting efforts ahead of the midterms. “I will be strongly endorsing against any State Senator or House member from the Great State of Indiana that votes against the Republican Party, and our Nation, by not allowing for Redistricting for…
title: Trump threatens to endorse against Indiana Republicans opposed to redistricting efforts

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The United States will designate Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles a foreign terrorist organization (FTO), Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced Sunday, amid heightened tensions between the two countries. In a statement, Rubio said the group is run by Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, whose government the U.S. has called “illegitimate.”   “Based in Venezuela, the…
title: US to designate Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles as terrorist group

author: Andy Bursky, opinion contributor
description: Bipartisan leaders in the House of Representatives have called for a bipartisan solution to the looming health insurance crisis, urging party leaders to listen to voices of reason and not play politics with people's lives and health care.
title: Don’t let the shutdown be for nothing

author: Caroline Vakil
description: President Trump said Sunday that New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani wants to meet with him in Washington, D.C. “The mayor of New York, I will say, would like to meet with us and we’ll work something out,” Trump told reporters while in Florida, apparently referring to Mamdani and not current Mayor Eric Adams (D). …
title: Trump says Mamdani wants to meet: ‘We’ll work something out’

author: Emily Brooks
description: Robert P. George, the McCormick professor of jurisprudence at Princeton University, announced Monday that he resigned from the Heritage Foundation board of trustees over the conservative think tank’s president, Kevin Roberts, defending Tucker Carlson for interviewing antisemitic commentator Nick Fuentes. “I have resigned from the board of the Heritage Foundation. I could not remain without a…
title: Heritage Foundation board member resigns over Tucker Carlson defense

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A whistleblower has accused Ed Martin of “concealing and destroying” communications related to his work as head of the Weaponization Working Group, sparking an investigation by House Judiciary Democrats. President Trump tapped Martin to investigate a number of probes into Trump’s conduct, with the attorney reviewing the work of former special counsel Jack Smith and…
title: Whistleblower accuses Ed Martin of ‘concealing and destroying’ records related to DOJ’s weaponization group

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) raised concerns on Sunday that the Trump Justice Department’s new probe into Jeffrey Epstein’s past ties with Democrats could interfere with Congress’s effort to mandate the full release of the files related to the late convicted sex offender. “The president’s been saying this is a hoax. He’s been saying that for…
title: Massie warns DOJ’s new Epstein probes may block document releases

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) on Sunday floated possible candidates to replace Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-Calif.) in his role as Senate minority leader shortly after Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.) criticized “freelance” opinions from the lower chamber. “Chris Murphy is a top leader. Cory Booker is a dynamic leader. Brian Schatz is a dynamic leader. I mean,…
title: Khanna floats Schumer replacements; Kaine knocks ‘freelance’ House opinions

author: Benjamin Zycher, opinion contributor
description: Congress must act, and the vehicle for doing so is the bipartisan SPEED Act, introduced by Reps. Bruce Westerman (R-Ark.) and Jared Golden (D-Maine).
title: Congress can help update our infrastructure by passing the SPEED Act

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court will review the legality of a now-rescinded immigration policy that turned away noncitizens attempting to cross the border from Mexico without considering their asylum claims, the court announced Monday.  Federal law guarantees a noncitizen who “arrives in the United States” may apply for asylum. The case concerns whether that extends to someone stopped on the Mexican side of the U.S.-Mexico border.  “In ordinary English, a…
title: Supreme Court to decide legality of ‘metering’ asylum seekers at border

author: David Charns
description: After Simpson's death, Fred Goldman filed a creditor's claim against the estate in Clark County District Court.
title: OJ Simpson’s estate agrees to pay $58M to Ron Goldman’s father

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Nancy Pelosi has avoided being beaten up by extremists in her party, unlike Charles Schumer and Mitch McConnell who have faced calls to resign for making deals with Republicans to keep the government open.
title: Schumer joins the club of party leaders punished for governing like adults

author: Austin Sarat, opinion contributor
description: This is all bad news for people seeking to end capital punishment in the United States. However, I don’t think that it suggests we are seeing a revival of the death penalty after a long period of decline in its use. In fact, other indicators suggest that capital punishment continued to atrophy in 2025.
title: Despite rise in executions this year, America’s death penalty has a bleak future

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump defended media host Tucker Carlson’s interview with white nationalist Nick Fuentes, saying on Sunday that the public should hear the controversial views and make up their own minds. Asked about Carlson’s recent “friendly interview with antisemite Nick Fuentes” and what role Carlson can play in the GOP going forward, the president recalled his…
title: Trump defends Tucker Carlson’s interview with Nick Fuentes

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump on Sunday said he’s changed his mind about how House Republicans should vote on a measure to release files related to Jeffrey Epstein, telling them to agree to release the documents. The House and Senate on Monday return to Washington, where the Epstein furor has engulfed Capitol Hill. The Epstein vote, forced by…
title: Live updates: In surprise, Trump tells House GOP to release Epstein files ahead of expected vote

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said he is talking with Democrats about a direct health care payment plan on Sunday amid negotiations to tackle rising health insurance premiums.  “I’ve had personal talks with some Democrats,” Trump told reporters in West Palm Beach, Fla., on Sunday before returning to Washington.  The president did not name the Democrats he said…
title: Trump says he’s talking to Democrats about direct health care payment plan

author: Becket Adams, opinion contributor
description: Shame on the New York Times and Dowd for once again running defense for a wretch just because he’s a Kennedy.
title: Oh no — not another Kennedy nepo baby!

author: Jared Gans
description: Morning Report is The Hill’s a.m. newsletter. Subscribe here. In today’s issue: ▪ President reverses ahead of Epstein vote ▪ Trump-MTG spat intensifies ▪ FAA ends all flight reductions ▪ Measles spread threatens US status President Trump made a late reversal declaring his support for releasing the Jeffrey Epstein files as the House appears set to approve…
title: Trump takes sharp U-turn on Epstein files

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump is calling on House Republicans to vote to release files linked to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after pressure has mounted on his administration. “As I said on Friday night aboard Air Force One to the Fake News Media, House Republicans should vote to release the Epstein files, because we have nothing to…
title: Trump calls on House Republicans to vote to release Epstein files
